document_data.name: Thallow
document_data.mainbody: '''Thallow''' was a species of plant found growing across the [[Eastern Heartlands|Eastern]] and [[Western Heartlands]], favored for use in personal hygiene.{{cite web| url = https://web.archive.org/web/20240405041010/http://www.candlekeep.com/library/articles/sse/sse_010203-06.htm| title = So Saith Ed Jan – Mar 2006| accessdate = 5-4-2024| date = 23-1-2006}}
document_data.Description: Thallow leaves were large, green, and almost rubbery, somewhat reminiscent of the [[rhubarb]] plant leaves. The leaves' toughness allowed for the use in personal clean up after [[nightsoil]] egestion, especially when on the road. Thallow leaves could also be washed to be reused later. They retained their usefulness and tough fibers for about three days when carried in a pack or a wagon. After three days, thallow shriveled and became fragile.
